etymology.description: Pictogram: cloth on a loom with crossing threads (originally the graph of 檷). Later borrowed phonetically (jiajie) to write 爾 ‘you’.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a loom with interlaced threads, the graph was later repurposed for its sound to represent the second-person pronoun in classical Chinese. The modern simplified form 尔 is an abridged shape of 爾 while preserving the borrowed meaning.
etymology.simplification: Officially simplified in 1956 by adopting the abridged form 尔 for 爾, reducing strokes for easier writing and printing.

examples.chinese: 尔等随我来(爾等隨我來)。
事毕之后(事畢之後)，尔后再议(爾後再議)。
examples.pinyin: shì bì zhī hòu, ěr hòu zài yì.
examples.english: After the matter is finished, we will discuss it again thereafter.

examples.chinese: 尔时春寒料峭(爾時春寒料峭)。
examples.pinyin: ěr shí chūn hán liào qiào.
examples.english: At that time, the early spring was still biting cold.
